description: Borrowed from French explicite, from Latin explicitus (“disentangled, easy”), variant of explicātus.

adjectives.description: explicit (comparative more explicit, superlative most explicit)

examples: Synonyms: express, manifest, overt; see also Thesaurus:explicit
I gave explicit instructions for him to stay here, but he followed me, anyway.

entries.meaning: (euphemistic) Containing material (e.g. language or film footage) that might be deemed offensive or graphic. [from 1971]
examples: The film had several scenes including explicit language and sex.

entries.meaning: The final few words of a text.

description: Abbreviated from Latin explicitus est līber (“the book is set in order, ended”).
